James Fellows, July 4, 1964, page 2
Because I feel that respect for the model as a form of communi-
cation is the one thing which binds us together irrevocably, I am
enclosing one*, It represents the dilemma into which I, myself, got
myself, with my own stipulations as to payments, and out of which I
want to get.
In stipulating one third of the fees in advance, one third upon
conclusion of the rough drafts, and one third upon completion of the
finished materials, I hop-headedly overlooked the fact that the writing
in this instance doesn’t proceed along those lines. We are doing a
rough draft....then a finished script...then a rough draft..then a
finished script, etc. Under this arrangement, the rough drafts won’t
be completed until almost the same time the finished scripts are com¬
pleted. All of which would be immaterial if I were John D. Rockefeller.
But I am Chub Benjamin,..in need of cash.
Therefore.,.the model, indicating that somewhere between the
first and the middle of August (because of interruptions in writing
brought about by measles, travel, production chores, preparation of
outline, etc.) I shall probably have finished three rough drafts
and three finished scripts.involving more tim.e and effort than
six rough drafts.
As of now, I have completed two rough drafts and two finished
shooting scripts.which constitute two-sixths or one-third of
one-third and two-sixths or one-third of another one-third,, ..and
some of the kit^materials for these films. This is roughly the
equivalent of two-thirds of one-third.,,orr roughly two times
$645...which is $1,290. If possible, I’d like to get something
approximating that amount now, as there are some things on the
family financial horizon (notes, tuition, books, son’s car pay¬
ments and repairs, family vacation trip) which it appears I must
^ake care of...and inthe summer my income from the University is
/reduced considerably.
script
When Film No. 6/is completed--!! it’s agreeable, I’d like to
get another one-third of the third...which would then correspond
to the payment due for completing all the rough drafts...though
actually we would have cogipleted three rough drafts and three
finished scripts.
The kit materials I am planning to prepare, insofar as I can,
as we do the films, so the packages will be ready to go out as
single entities ahead of the full series package, in case you
want to distribute them that way.
I’ll be very grateful (and scjwill a few other peoplel) if you
can see your way clear to revamping the payment schedule to this
somewhat more applicable approach.
Am looking forward to seeing you at the July meeting (whenever
and wherever it may be.Jf I’m celebrating the Glorious Fourth and
